title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Never heard back after interviewing. I was very surprised. Not even an email. This was the same experience for others that applied. I expected more from them. I won’t apply for other opportunities.
Interview Questions: If needed, could I meeting with students after hours.

title: Video Producer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Nice people to interview with and a casual setting. Both interviews were done remotely. The questions ranged from easy to slightly difficult to answer. The interview was done using Zoom and included a pannel of about 5 people.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience using lighting equipment.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was online and the team lead asked me a basic white board question and for the second interview it was more for about me with the boss.
Interview Questions: What sort of things are you interested in?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Typical for a tenure-track job in academia: long + short list. First interview online, then face-to-face for short list. Campus visit was very pleasant and people were really nice and friendly. Two-three intense days, but overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Nothing atypical. Research scope and teaching style were the focus of the interview.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Typical academic interview.  First via skype, followed by an in-person, on-campus, two-day affair.   Nothing particularly special about it, having interviewed in the private sector it is increasingly difficult to look at the academic interview process as anything other than hazing.
Interview Questions:
-Talk about your pedagogy
-Talk about diversity inclusion and equity
-Asked about scholar/teacher "values" (this is not really what BSU values, they are a teaching institution, real support for scholarship is virtually non-existent.)

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: This interview process involved a single in-person interview with my manager. They explained the main resposibilities that this role entailed and gave me a tour of the facilities. I was introduced to a few faculty members, and we discussed a good start date and schedule to ensure that among the 3 or so student employees they planned on hiring that there would always be someone covering the front desk.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What is your major? What is your year in school?
What prior experience do you have that has prepared you for this role?
Do you have any customer service experience?
How many hours would you be willing to work?
What does your availability look like for the upcoming academic year?
Would you be willing to work over school breaks and/or the summer semester?

title: Yoga Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process. Great people to talk to and collaborate with. It was a 2 step interview process followed by a shadowing opportunity of the current instructors that are teaching some of the classes in the program.
Interview Questions: What is one quality you posses that would make you a great instructor?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview. Despite it being with a panel of interviewers, it was very friendly and wasn't overwhelming. Received an offer and all communication was done quickly and efficiently.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Front Desk Hotel Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Was for a student position so the interview was fairly easy and only lasted about 30 minutes. Received an offer within the next few days. Overall, the entire process from applying to receiving and accepting my offer lasted about two weeks, only because it was the beginning of the semester and the hotel was busy st the time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, when are you planning to graduate, willing to work weekends, etc.

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long and grueling and communication throughout is not great. By the time they offered me the job I had already found a position elsewhere. I would have loved to been employed by Ball State but they are not considerate of others time.
Interview Questions: What drew you to Ball State University?

title: Project Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, they look for passion and the ability to learn over experience and skill - they give you a semester of training to learn what you need for the job
Interview Questions: How do you motivate people?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Sent in my application using career services, the next day I received an email requesting an interview and went in for the interview and was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest strengths

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very friendly and easy to connect to. Always willing to help and answer any questions. They expect you to be prepared and come with a lot of questions.
Interview Questions: How would you showcase your leadership skills?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was very conversational - Though I was referred through a mutual acquaintance. Because of that I had already been 'pre screened' as a person of interest and with matching experience. We talked about by professional experience and the goals of the teaching program and how those two worlds intersect. We talked about my educational experience and how those positive experiences could be replicated through my position as an adjunct instructor.
Interview Questions: They asked to know about my position on 'practical' vs 'artistic' education.. I don't remember the exact wording but the sentiment was to get at how important I felt 'real' world' application and constraints are to the studio design process... Lots of schools value design with a capital "D" and worry less about practical application of architecture.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with them at ASSA in 2020 for an Assistant Professor of Economics.  The Search Committee were very friendly. However, they only contacted the finalists.
Interview Questions: Tell them about the background.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: kind interviewers, made me feel comfortable I wanted to know if I was qualified. They asked industry related information about working there. Some questions covered my personality, while others asked more direct marketing questions.
Interview Questions: How important are brand guidelines to a company or organization?

title: Senior Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Swift and easy. Very friendly staff. They had very reasonable questions and valued my answers and gave time for me to answer fully. Additionally, the timing was exactly what they had promised. Overall, a very good experience.
Interview Questions: What values do you like to see in your work environment?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of basic interview questions. It was a pretty informal process and I got a call back a few days later saying that I got the job. Paperwork had to be filled out in the Career Center on campus.
Interview Questions: When was a time when you solved a problem?

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Met with a variety of campus stakeholders. Had an opportunity to meet future colleagues. Gained a sense of the organizational expectations. Met with leadership of the organization. Participated in a campus tour.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Computer Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: One interview consisting of technical questions and trying to gauge if I had the skills necessary. It was a very comfortable atmosphere for the interview in his office handed out paperwork going over guidelines and prerequisites.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with MacOS and Windows?

title: Food Service Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. You sign up for the job and they give you the job. You have to re-sign up every year but get a raise. Its a great on campus job and it doesn't get very difficult.
Interview Questions: Were there interview questions?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Extremely competitive. Many individuals are seeking employment at Ball State University. I was astonished to find that they DO NOT want job seekers to call to check on applications. They also will deny job seekers employment if they are over qualified.
Interview Questions: How do you organize yourself?

title: Ball Boy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (New Haven, CT) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Made me touch Lotta balls and I didn't want to promise anything and then have to back out later than most schools in door and it seems like it is going well.
Interview Questions: Ur balls are hanging out?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Gave a presentation to the whole of the admissions staff than two one on one interviews. They flew me in for the interview and had me stay at the campus hotel. They reimbursed me for the whole process.
Interview Questions: Asked why I wanted to work in admissions

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short and sweet. Very technical questions mixed in with the basic interview questions. It was just two people and they both took time to write down my answers and ask for more details.
Interview Questions: What are your career expectations over the next 5 years?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Ball State University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief and they really just asked to see my class schedule and then I got the job! I was able to begin the very next day and I really enjoyed the job because I was able to interact with a lot of people. The great part about it is that I got to go some networking.
Interview Questions: How open is your class schedule?

title: Ticket Sales Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had prior relationship with the hiring manager, and therefore only took one phone interview to discuss my approach to the position and the specific skills related to it. For a new applicant, I would expect a simple first interview, followed by a second interview either via phone or skype.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the Economics Department administrative coordinator and scheduled an interview. The interview was very laid-back and personal. It gave me a great feel for the culture of the work environment. It was prompt, but in depth enough as to allow me to make my own judgement about working there.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sit down for a one on one interview with staff from the library. Then discuss previous work experience, customer service skills and experience, discuss school standards, discuss experience in an office environment, and discuss availability as well as how many semesters of school can be committed to working at the library.
Interview Questions: What customer service experience do you have?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ball State University in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I filled out a form and was later interviewed through a phone interview. I was interviewed for about an hour about how I would handle various teaching situations, my research experiences, and my future at Ball State University.
Interview Questions: What is a situation that you had to deal with a difficult conflict and how did you solve it?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Ball State University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very extensive but informative. It was about 4 rounds and each one allowed the opportunity for questions. I would say it was standard university procedures. Also be prepared to take a background check and show proof of record.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this university? Describe a time you failed and how did you learn from it.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were conducted around March-April. I received a phone call from the department office early March to schedule the interview for mid March. The process consisted of one phone interview (in person if you were close to Muncie, Indiana) that lasted for about 1 hour. Selections were made in April and offers extended end of April/early May.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to attend grad school/this particular program?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: I saw the position on the school's career website and applied online. The process was very straightforward and easy to follow. I got a phone screen interview and then was interviewed by the director of the program. Over all. it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Digtial Corps - Video Apprentice Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 separate interviews, one with the team lead and one with the boss. It is very tough to get selected to be interviewed, let alone make it past the team lead or even the boss if you get there. A lot of people lose hope of getting hired here. You have to show personality and enthusiasm, not just skill.
Interview Questions: What is something unique about you?

title: Lead Computer Systems Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: Started out as a personal interview about myself and interests and turned to a more technical side  about my degree, knowledge of specific systems, experience with software and hardware and where I want to end up eventually after I have achieved my degree. I was then introduced to the existing technicians and given an overview of job responsibilities and what we are responsible for.
Interview Questions: Port is showing low link level. What may be the issue?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of three meetings. I met with a panel of Ball State leaders that assessed my qualifications in the first round. Each round I met with new individuals, but it was never intimidating. The atmosphere of these interviews were relaxed and friendly. For me that is what made is less intimidating, and more exciting.
Interview Questions: How do you respond to difficult situations? Can you give an example?

title: Peer Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for this particular job was very laid back. Since it's mostly a student position, the questions are focused on your personality and qualities you will bring to the job. This job is looking for students who loves to promoting the Ball State Career Center and being personable to students across campus.
Interview Questions: What method do you use to solve a problem?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Ask general question, how good you are with several tools. do you like to work with us, then talk you with professors and tell them your status, and ask them about their job
Interview Questions: Do you like work with us

title: Information Systems Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: You will be interviewed by seniors and maybe some junior who have been working in the department for some time.  They will ask you questions about your technology background and anything that relates to desktop support.
Interview Questions: Depending on the students and Administrative Coordinator that interview you they will ask you questions about your tech background and how well you work with others.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was unique in the fact that I had never really heard of the company I was applying for. I was referred by a current employee and was lucky enough to be granted an interview. My favorite part was the "nerdy thirty."
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the Digital Corps?

title: Temp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I meet with a group of people from the department, and each person asked my questions and I answered them.  Then they took me around the office to show me the environment that the job would operate in if I were hired.
Interview Questions: They asked about my former job

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was basically to have you come in and schedule, most locations rather laid back.  Positions for students are for a wide range of jobs from food prep to serving, or even cleaning.  Shifts are short and rather easy.  Job is easy to get because it has a high turn over rate and honestly I think this is because the general population of Ball State students are spoiled and this is their first job...  For people who have survived jobs like retail, this is very very easy, to get and to keep.
Interview Questions: No questions

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ball State University
Interview Descriptions: submit application and transcript. it was a simple process overall, very none stressful
Interview Questions: none, really

title: Conferences and Special Events Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really laid back! I applied for the job via the Career Center at Ball State. After that, the office director contacted me for an interview. I had my interview the next day in her office in Carmichael Hall. After that, she told me right in the interview that she wanted to hire me. I started the next week.
Interview Questions: Do you have an secretarial experience?

title: Office Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Sat on a bench and asked if I was interested in the field of study and if I could handle the responsibilities
Sat on a bench and asked if I was interested in the field of study and if I could handle the responsibilities
Sat on a bench and asked if I was interested in the field of study and if I could handle the responsibilities
Interview Questions: Organizational skills? Time management?

title: Software Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Quick, Easy and Painless. The Human Resources staff made sure I was comfortable from the beginning until the end of the process. They worked at a very high professional level and I was very pleased.
Interview Questions: What is RAM?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Get paper from the career center, call number on paper, submit application, bring class schedule, expect phone call back to schedule, news within the week.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths/weaknesses?

title: Media Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: I only had one interview and was offered the position on the spot. I first interviewed with the Graduate Assistant before speaking with the official supervisor. Both were very nice and the conversation was very relaxed.
Interview Questions: How flexible is your schedule?

title: Chef Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews.  Second was a cooking demo.  Everyone was polite.  Human resources was prompt in presenting offers.  Hiring was smooth.  Lots of training for new hires.  Everything was smooth.  As butter.
Interview Questions: What is one of the defining moment in your career.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two people, during which I expressed why I wanted to work in their department, shared my background, and explained how well of a fit I would be, and they agreed!
Interview Questions: How will your experiences translate to the use of the Banner system?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring/interview process here is rather easy, really. You'll be asked a lot of generic questions, like "do you prefer to work alone or on a team." Answers will be obvious, like, "I enjoy both." 

You'll interview with the Director, then with the support staff, then with the professional staff (who will be your peers in the job). For the professional staff, you'll be required to give a 10-minute presentation with the topic, "Why you should choose Ball State." Focus on the big points, like Immersive Learning, academics, facilities, athletics.
Interview Questions: "Why should we not hire you?"

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Just be yourself, Belieive in yourself and trust in your abilities. It is a great job. I thought I already wrote 30 words so here you go. Ok that was not enough so heres some more.
Interview Questions: What is a computer?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ball State University (Muncie, IL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interiewed by the PI, asked about my previous experience, why I was interested in the current position. This was for recruiting patients for a study, so they wanted someone Bilingual, with good communication skills and good interpersonal skills. They wanted someone who was a team player and could get along with others on the team. This was a very laid back interview. I had to study the research project becuase I had answer questions effectively which would show them why I was interested in the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Director, Contracts and Grants Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Ball State University in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing process was the usual for a university--a committee, but the person to whom the position reported said that he would be the one making the decision.  He was quite nice and I liked him.  He did have adequate training for his job but, as was usual at that location, he had not worked anyplace else--did his undergraduate and graduate training there.
Interview Questions: N/A
